# Summary

| Physical activity has gained a lot of attention in the past decades given the body of evidence that supports its benefits to different health outcomes, in specific to hypokinetic diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, obesity, diabetes and even cancer. To prevent and treat these diseases, it is important to understand the complex pathways that leads people to exercise more. Green spaces are known to provide multiple benefits to the wellness and health of the population and had been proposed to be an important mediator to increase levels of physical activity. Hence, we wanted to study if there is an association between green spaces and physical fitness in young adults.
